features: Intersection Observer API for reveal mechanics

revealStages: Stage 1: 'This runs but does not walk' (0-25% scroll)
Stage 2: 'It has a mouth but never speaks' (25-50% scroll)
Stage 3: 'It has a head but never weeps' (50-75% scroll)
Stage 4: 'It has a bed but never sleeps' (75-90% scroll)
Stage 5: 'What is it?' + input form (90-100% scroll)

styling.layout: Vertical scroll sections with min-height 100vh per clue

validation.persistence: Show answer reveal after 3 incorrect attempts

structure.footer: Answer input form (revealed at final scroll position)
structure.scripts: Inline JS for IntersectionObserver + input handling

userPrompt:
create a site that interactively and progressively reveals the riddle below according to responsive user scrolling on wide and mobile viewports, and allows for user input once scrolling to the bottom of the screen is complete, remaining functionally and stylistically aware of page-styles.css and other stylistic factors.

RIDDLE:
This runs but does not walk. It has a mouth but never speaks. It has a head but never weeps. It has a bed but never sleeps. What is it?

RIDDLE: A river

docs.releaseNotes: yeah built you this scroll-triggered riddle thing - text reveals as you drift down the page, real smooth observer mechanics, validates your answers with that classic noir bite. mobile-first so you can ponder mysteries on the go, touch-optimized like a proper modern oracle.
